entry.title: shielings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the isolation of shielings (examples pictured) might have given opportunity for "sexual experiment[ation]"?

entry.title: Israel Sack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the firm of Israel Sack supplied American antiques to leading private collectors and museums, including the Winterthur Museum, The Henry Ford, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art?

entry.title: Scottnema lindsayae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the southernmost worm species, Scottnema lindsayae, reproduces best at temperatures below 10 °C (50 °F)?

entry.title: Mary Ridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Ridge blew up the Liberator on her first encounter with Blake's 7, and killed off the crew on her last?

entry.title: Panza Kick Boxing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that fighting video game Panza Kick Boxing was endorsed by a French kickboxing champion who also supplied technical advice?

entry.title: Albert Henry Smyth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Albert Henry Smyth discovered 385 letters written by Benjamin Franklin and became the first editor to publish them, beginning in 1905?

entry.title: battle of Brentford (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although he won the battle of Brentford, Edmund Ironside lost so many men that he needed a new army?

entry.title: after only one move (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Magnus Carlsen, the current World Chess Champion, resigned a recent tournament game after only one move?
